done

comments.body: DNS: should not be required because its an add-on for v1

The kube2sky implementation of DNS is stored in the cluster/addons directory.  But, 
I was considering requiring that all clusters have some kind of DNS support to be conformant.   But, I've run out of time getting it to work, so, it will need to wait until vNext.

comments.body: listing the test patterns _excluded_ but then using a regex to only _include_ certain tests basically guarantees that at least one of the lists will become out of date. are we OK with this?
Fair point.  I've rephrased it as a skip.

comments.body:
nit, but this would have been more immediately understandable if it looked like this:

KUBERNETES_CONFORMANCE_TEST_VERSION="1.0"

This isn't meant to imply a version.  
1 is just a string that passes this test: `[[ -n "${KUBERNETES_CONFORMANCE_TEST}" ]]`.
Oh, haha. I guess I'll suggest RUN_KUBERNETES_CONFORMANCE_TEST="true" for a followup, then.
or "y". We seem to use both throughout the codebase...
